title: Kinetic and static friction - nail sliding down in

content.question: A nail is placed upside-down on a board, as shown. The coefficients of static and kinetic friction between the nail and the board are <math alttext="mu sub s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>s</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="mu sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>k</mtext></msub></math>, respectively. The left end of the board is slowly raised so that the board’s angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> with the horizontal increases. As soon as the nail begins to slide down the board without tipping over, the board is held in place at that angle. The nail continues to slide down the board with constant velocity. Which of the following can be concluded about <math alttext="mu sub s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>s</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="mu sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>k</mtext></msub></math> based on these observations?

choices.label: <math alttext="mu sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>k</mtext></msub></math> is nearly equal to <math alttext="mu sub s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>s</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="mu sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>k</mtext></msub></math> is nearly equal to zero

<math alttext="mu sub k " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>k</mtext></msub></math> increases and <math alttext="mu sub s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>s</mtext></msub></math> decreases as the board’s angle is increased

<math alttext="mu sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>k</mtext></msub></math> decreases and <math alttext="mu sub s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>s</mtext></msub></math> increases as the board’s angle is increased

content.answer: <math alttext="mu sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>k</mtext></msub></math> is nearly equal to <math alttext="mu sub s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mtext>s</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
